metadata.name: Linux Base64 Encoded Shebang In CLI
metadata.comment: Detects the presence of a base64 version of the shebang in the commandline, which could indicate a malicious payload about to be decoded

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('iyevymlul2jhc2')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('iyevymlul2rhc2')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('iyevymlul3pza')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('iyevymlul2zpc2')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('iyevymlul3no'))))

output.summary: Detects the presence of a base64 version of the shebang in the commandline, which could indicate a malicious payload about to be decoded

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate administration activities References: https://www.trendmicro.com/pl_pl/research/20/i/the-evolution-of-malicious-shell-scripts.html, https://github.com/carlospolop/PEASS-ng/tree/master/linPEAS
